title: Hockey to foot most of his legal bill
text:
Thu, Jul 23, 2015, 3:51 AM AEST - Australia Markets open in 6 hrs 9 mins Hockey to foot most of his legal bill AAP â€“ 19 minutes ago Print 
Treasurer Joe Hockey will have to pay 85 per cent of his hefty legal costs in his defamation case against Fairfax. 
Mr Hockey was awarded $200,000 for defamation last month but his legal bill will leave him with a blow-hut of hundreds of thousands of dollars. 
The Federal Court ruled Fairfax defamed Mr Hockey when it splashed the words "Treasurer for Sale" across a Sydney Morning Herald promotional poster and two tweets from The Age. 
But the court dismissed the rest of Mr Hockey's claims that the articles defamed him. 
On Wednesday, Justice Richard White delivered Mr Hockey a blow when his costs order fell well short of the 95 per cent he was chasing. 
Instead, the publisher will pay only 15 per cent of the treasurer's costs. 
The combined total bill exceeds $1 million, Fairfax Media reported, leaving Mr Hockey with a substantial share to pay. 
But Mr Hockey says he has no regrets about taking the action. 
He said he took the action to "stand up to malicious people". 
"Whilst the cost of this action has been considerable for me, my family and friends, it has been far greater for Fairfax Media," he said in a statement. 
"They are clearly not `Independent. Always'." 
The comments come after Fairfax's barrister Sandy Dawson told the Federal Court earlier this month the case "was an unmitigated disaster for Mr Hockey and a costs order should reflect that". @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook
